intro: Zornia muelleriana subsp. muelleriana, commonly known as the Mueller's zornia, is a perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit with hairy, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. This species is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological resilience.
